intro: Velleia paradoxa var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf velleia, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy texture. The plant produces tiny white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Its unique appearance and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanists and gardeners alike.
